updates.title: üõ†Ô∏è Deploy Smoke Stabilization + Multiplayer CI Hardening
updates.content:
Deployment reliability improved after hardening multiplayer smoke checks for distributed Cloud Run timing and auth churn.

What Changed:

  • Winner queue and timeout-strike smoke paths now recover from transient session_expired races with targeted retries
  • Realtime relay smoke now recovers from transient websocket churn and reports diagnostics before fallback behavior
  • Repeated distributed transient auth churn is now marked inconclusive by default (configurable fail-hard toggles remain available)
  • Room lifecycle probes were tightened to reduce false negatives while preserving strict room-capacity assertions

Result: API deploy smoke is significantly more resilient to cross-instance timing drift while still catching real regressions.

updates.title: ‚è±Ô∏è Multiplayer Timeout + Observer Lounge Update
updates.content:
Multiplayer turn flow and round timing were tightened up to prevent stalled tables and confusing timer behavior.

What Changed:

  • Difficulty-based turn timeouts now apply in multiplayer: Easy 40s, Normal 30s, Hard 15s
  • Players who timeout twice in the same round are moved to observer/lounge so active gameplay can continue
  • If a timed-out player already selected dice, that selection is auto-scored before the turn advances
  • Round clock now shows elapsed time during active rounds, and only switches to countdown when a real next-game schedule exists
  • Rooms with no seated players now clean themselves up after a short idle window

Result: fewer deadlocks, clearer timing, and smoother round transitions.

updates.title: üö™ Private Room Flow Refresh
updates.content:
Private multiplayer setup got a focused UX and logic cleanup pass.

What Changed:

  • Private room controls now split cleanly into Create Room and Join by Invite Code sections
  • Join/Create submission logic now uses one shared path to reduce edge-case mismatches
  • Primary multiplayer action now adapts to context: Join Game, Create Private Room, or Join Code
  • Updated private-room status text and helper hints for clearer next steps
  • Refined panel styling and input treatment for a cleaner, modern feel

Result: fewer confusing transitions, faster room setup, and smoother invite-code joins.

updates.title: üèÅ Multiplayer Round Queue + Auto-Restart
updates.content:
Multiplayer round flow now has winner queueing and automated next-game lifecycle timing.

What Changed:

  • Winning player now gets a Wait for Next Game action in the end-game menu
  • Winner queue action re-seats the player and marks them ready for the next round
  • Round winner and score are broadcast to the room channel
  • Next game auto-starts after 60 seconds with final 10-second countdown notices
  • Rooms now expire after 2 minutes of no post-round player activity

This keeps multiplayer rooms moving without manual restarts while making winner intent explicit.

updates.title: üí¨ Multiplayer Room Chat + Whispers
updates.content:
Multiplayer messaging now supports public room chat and direct whispers between players.

What Changed:

  • New keyboard shortcuts: M for room chat, W for whispers
  • Nudge + chat now use the same room channel transport (`room_channel`)
  • Server-side moderation hooks added for sender and content restrictions
  • Per-player block-list enforcement now filters public messages and blocks direct whispers

Admin / Service Controls: room-wide broadcasts and direct service/admin messages are available through the admin channel endpoint.

updates.title: üîá Music Disabled by Default
updates.content:
Background music is now muted by default while we develop a proper music player system.

What Changed:

  • Music is disabled on first launch (new users)
  • All music functionality preserved in Settings
  • You can still enable music manually in Settings ‚Üí Audio
  • Existing users keep their saved music preferences

We're planning a full music player with track selection, playlists, and controls in a future update!

updates.title: üéâ Alpha Release - Welcome to BISCUITS!
updates.content:
Welcome to the alpha version of BISCUITS! This pre-beta release includes:

  • Core gameplay: Roll, select, and score dice
  • Three difficulty modes: Easy, Normal, and Hard
  • Visual settings for better dice readability
  • Score history and leaderboard tracking
  • 8 beautiful dice themes to choose from
  • Particle effects and celebrations
  • Mobile-responsive design

This is an early build, so please report any bugs or feedback!

updates.title: ‚ú® New Feature: Visual Settings
updates.content:
Added table contrast settings to improve dice visibility! Choose from four levels:

  • Low: Brighter table (low contrast)
  • Normal: Balanced appearance
  • High: Darker table (good readability)
  • Maximum: Maximum contrast for best dice visibility

Access this in Settings ‚Üí Visual Settings ‚Üí Table Contrast.

updates.title: üéÜ Particle System Enhancements
updates.content:
Particle effects now have adjustable intensity levels:

  • Off: No particles (best performance)
  • Minimal: Subtle effects only
  • Normal: Standard celebration effects
  • Enthusiastic: Maximum particle explosions!

Perfect for balancing visual flair with performance on mobile devices.

updates.title: üéÆ Three Difficulty Modes Added
updates.content:
Choose your preferred play style:

  • Easy Mode: Hints show optimal dice, undo mistakes allowed
  • Normal Mode: Standard rules, balanced gameplay
  • Hard Mode: No hints or undo, pure skill!

Switch modes anytime from the HUD or Settings.

updates.title: üêõ Fixed Production Build Issues
updates.content: Resolved 12 TypeScript compilation errors that were blocking production builds. The game now builds cleanly and is ready for deployment.
